text.text: Security Asset Type : Payment Processing Infrastructure

data.name: Security Asset Type : Payment Processing Infrastructure

text.text: Privacy Asset Type : Customer Personal Identifiable Information (PII).

data.name: Privacy Asset Type : Customer Personal Identifiable Information (PII).
Asset : Web App
data.description:
Security Description : This is the web app for the infrastructure thorough which all the customers financial transactions are moderated for EaaS software System.
Security Value : High

threats.title: DDoS Attack
threats.description:
Security Vulnerability : Cybercriminals overwhelming EaaS Payment Servers to disrupt the financial operations.
Security Risk :  High. Financial Loss and Reputational Damage.
threats.mitigation:
Security Controls :
1.Web Application Firewall (WAF) & DDoS Protection.
Deploy a cloud-based DDoS mitigation service (e.g., AWS Shield, Cloudflare).
Implement rate limiting & bot detection for payment requests.
Use AI-driven traffic analysis to detect unusual surges.

2. Immutable Backups with Real-Time Anomaly Detection.
Maintain offline, immutable backups of payment data.
Implement automated response mechanisms to isolate infected systems.
Use real-time anomaly detection (e.g., detecting unusual encryption of files).

threats.title: Credential Stuffing & Brute Force Attacks
threats.description:
Gaining unauthorized access to payment accounts.
Security Vulnerability :
Weak Authentication/ Password Management Mechanisms.

Security Risk: High
Financial Loss, Reputational Damage
threats.mitigation:
Security Controls :
1.Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
Enforce MFA for all user logins, especially for high-privilege accounts.
Implement password less authentication (e.g. passkeys) where feasible.
Enable adaptive authentication (e.g., blocking logins from unusual locations).

threats.title: Data Correlation & Profiling
threats.description: Privacy Vulnerability : Over-collection of PII leading to excessive profiling.
threats.mitigation:
Privacy Controls :
1. Data Anonymization & Pseudonymization
Replace direct identifiers (e.g., names, phone numbers) with pseudonyms.
Store mapping tables separately with access controls.
Apply irreversible anonymization techniques where feasible.

threats.title: Unlawful Data Processing
threats.description: Collecting, storing, or sharing PII without consent or legitimate purpose.
threats.mitigation:
Privacy Control:
1.Consent Management Platform
Provide granular consent options (e.g., opt-in for marketing but not for data sharing).
Enable easy data subject access requests (DSAR) for deletion, rectification, or export.
Maintain logs of consent history for auditing and regulatory compliance.

threats.title: Lack of User Control
threats.description: Customers unable to manage their personal data, request deletion, or opt out.
threats.mitigation:
Privacy Control:
1.Consent Management Platform.
Provide granular consent options (e.g., opt-in for marketing but not for data sharing).
Enable easy data subject access requests (DSAR) for deletion, rectification, or export.
Maintain logs of consent history for auditing and regulatory compliance.

threats.title: Data Breaches
threats.description:
Security Vulnerabilities:
Weak/Inconsistent data access controls.
SQL Injections

Security Risk :
Financial Loss, Reputational Damage
threats.mitigation:
Security Controls :
1.Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) with Least Privilege.
Restrict access to payment data based on job roles.
Regularly audit access logs to detect unusual patterns.
Apply zero-trust principles—never assume implicit trust

threats.title: API Exploits
threats.description:
Unsecured APIs leading to unauthorized access or data leaks.

Security Vulnerabilities : 
Unprotected API’s: Unsecured APIs may allow unauthorized access.

Security Risk: Financial Loss, Reputational Damage
threats.mitigation:
Security Controls :
1.API Security Gateway
Use an API Gateway to enforce authentication, authorization, and rate limiting.
Implement OAuth 2.0 and API tokens for secure access.
Regular security scans to identify and fix API vulnerabilities.

data.name: Control : WAF
data.description: Mitigates :  SQL Injection and DDoS attacks
